function_call.name: get_risks
function_call.arguments: {"risks":[{"Description":"Inability to conduct meta-analyses for fasting blood glucose, cholesterol, HbA1c, asthma, and triglycerides due to lack of high quality studies","Impact":"Limited understanding of the relationship between these health factors and the built environment, inhibiting effective disease mitigation strategies.","Mitigation":"Encourage and support the conduct of high quality studies in these areas to gather necessary data for meta-analyses.","Technologies":"Research funding and data collection technologies for health studies.","People":"Public health researchers, epidemiologists, and funding agencies.","Owner":"Public health organizations, research institutions, and funding agencies."},{"Description":"Inability to conduct sensitivity analysis due to meta-analyses consisting only of studies scoring \\\\u2265 9","Impact":"Limitations in understanding the robustness of the meta-analyses and their potential biases, reducing confidence in the results.","Mitigation":"Strive for higher diversity in the quality of studies included in meta-analyses to enable sensitivity analysis.","Technologies":"Statistical methods for sensitivity analysis and tools for evaluating study quality.","People":"Meta-analysts, statisticians, and researchers conducting systematic reviews.","Owner":"Health research institutions, academic institutions, and research funding agencies."},{"Description":"Inability to conduct meta-analysis for certain health outcomes such as cancer, respiratory mortality, and neurological outcomes due to lack of comparable results from multiple studies","Impact":"Incomplete understanding of the relationship between greenspace and these health outcomes, hindering the development of targeted interventions to reduce disease risk.","Mitigation":"Encourage the standardization of health outcome measurements and criteria in research studies to enable meta-analyses in these areas.","Technologies":"Health outcome measurement standards and data sharing platforms for research collaboration.","People":"Public health researchers, epidemiologists, and standardization bodies.","Owner":"Research institutions, public health organizations, and standardization bodies."}]}
